revision.text: ==English== ===Etymology=== [[backslang|Backslang]] for {{m|en|middy}}, from {{m|en|midshipman}}. ===Noun=== {{en-noun}} # {{lb|en|obsolete|nautical|back slang}} A [[midshipman]]. #* {{quote-book |en |year=1826 |last=Wood |first=George |title=The Rambles of Redbury Rook |chapter=X |page=168 |pageurl=https://books.google.com/books?id=hQ9gAAAAcAAJ&pg=PA168 |passage=He was conveyed to one of our ships of war, and there he remained a few years, doing all kinds of drudgery, when, from his great activity in reefing the sails, and other seamen-like duties, he so far distinguished himself, as to obtain the good-will of his captain, who had him rated a '''''Yddim'''''. }} ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=ddimy|didym|middy|mydid}} [[Category:English 2-syllable words]]
